author: BsurreyUK
title: Home from home
text:
Stayed here many many times and this time went mad by having the top suite (again !) but for two weeks.
The hotel is going through some changes and we soon discovered that the 3 hotels in the group had all been sold on 1st February to the owners of the Mount Nelson Hotel in Cape Town but this was expected to produce extra funding to improve the Marine still further.
We had been concerned about the decision to close the Pavilion restaurant for dinner and rely solely on Origins (formerly the Seafood restaurant). However the food was very good and we ate there on a number of occasions. Having said that we did miss the option of a fine dining restaurant and so ate out more frequently than in earlier years simply in the interests of variety.
The staff have always been exceptional at the Marine and 2017 was no exception with Letitia and Regina standing out. Thanks too to Claudia and her colleagues on the Travel Desk for making all those restaurant bookings for us. Annemie, the General Manager, was very professional with an eye for detail and could not have done more to make our stay any more sublime.
We will be back !
Room Tip: Always try for a sea view room on the 1st floor. See more room tips
